alert.note: Alert for Torrance; Valencia (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 07 at 6:26PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central New Mexico, including the following counties, Torrance and Valencia. * WHEN...Until 900 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 624 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms moving slowly west from Meadow Lake toward Los Lunas and Belen. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Los Lunas, Belen, Valencia, Bosque Farms, El Cerro Mission, Meadow Lake, Rio Communities North, Tome, Los Chaves, Rio Communities, Los Trujillos-Gabaldon, Peralta and Adelino. - This includes the following highways... State Roads 47 and 314, and Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 191 and 207. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
